comment: He was a very cool professor, make sure you attend his class because attendance is mandatory. His test are really easy 5 definitions and then a essay question, super easy class and a really good professor to take.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Take this professor, the test are very easy you only have two essays the rest are test. Make sure to attend class, because he takes attendance. Study the terms and you will pass the course! Easy A.

I loved this class! Every lecture was super entertaining, as I feel like we often talked about aspects of US history that get overlooked. We had two short essays and three exams, which were all straight-forward and quite easy. I would 10/10 recommend taking him!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HIM FOR AN EASY A. He gives two essays and two to three tests, plus a final,, but they are all very easy. The tests consist of terms that you select 3-4 and define them, but they are all pretty easy to learn and remember. There is an essay-style question, but there are only one or two paragraphs that are all easy to study for. Study!

Takes attendance and will drop a letter grade if you miss 4 days but he has missed class over 5 times this semester. Doesn't care if you are shy, he expects you to speak up. Is a harsh grader. Said that a sentence was confusing without explanation. Is very unorganized and is switching things up. However he does allow make-up test so that's nice!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Funny & caring professor, few assignments. Attendance is technically graded for 10pts but he's lenient with it you'll really only lose all 10 if you never go to class. He definitely prepares you to get 100's on the 3 exams and offers feedback on the 3 papers to get A's there too. Easy A with nice prof would take again.

This course is very easy. He teaches from PowerPoints that he posts for everyone to view so it's not necessary to take notes during class. There is a free textbook that I never used and I was still able to excel in the course. The course has 3 exams 2 short essays and an attendance grade for the whole semester. No homework 10/10 would recommend!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Multiple tests and papers but he is not a harsh grader. Provides study guides and does not take daily attendance, but he lectures every day so attendance is highly encouraged. He is very helpful and informative. All tests and papers are turned in and done on paper, nothing is ever online.

Pretty good professor. The "textbook" is an online website, which is great! Class has 2 essays, 3 exams, and attendance is mandatory or else your grade is dropped a letter. Canceled class a few times, announces very early the morning of. Attend class and you will be just fine. I recommend asking him to read a rough draft of your essay.

Super funny and chill guy, his class is always a great way to start my morning and get a laugh in. If you enjoy history like I do, his lectures are interesting and relevant. His class is incredibly easy and you're only graded on three exams and two papers. Would 1000% take again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Attendance is "required" and will affect a letter grade but apparently, he has yet to take attendance during class. Lectures can be boring, but he makes helpful comments for what you can write for the exams. Exams are just picking 3 terms and discussing what it is and why it's important and then a discussion question.
Exams are writing sections and are graded very easily, you choose the terms you want to write about. Lectures are boring, but its worth going to for exams.

We were only graded on two essays and two exams, which were very easy. Just make sure you know the basic concepts and be able to write a little less than a paragraph for each for the tests. He did miss a lot of classes but I'm okay with that since it was still easy to pass his class.

As long as you show up to class and take notes you will get an A. He canceled a lot of classes but it helped me focus on other classes and the 2nd exam was just turned into the final exam. The exams are quite simple as long as you remember the definitions of the terms and their importance. Impossible to fail this class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a great professor, and doesn't just teach from the powerpoint. He makes the lectures interesting and had me intrigued in what we were teaching. Only downside is he cancelled a BUNCH of classes due to being sick which isn't his fault; however, class has only happened I think 6-7 times so far. He did accomodate to help with missing classes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: he's a good professor but misses alot of classes :)

At the beginning of the year, he hinted that attendance wouldn't be taken. At the end of the year, he gave many people failing attendance/participation grades since they weren't at the random 7 classes he decided to take attendance. Good professor, just don't question his authority. Tests were easy if you study a little.
